data.title: Template:Keisei Station Numbering
data.text:
This templates is used to display an icon identifying Keisei Electric Railway stations. It can be abbreviated {{KSSN}}.

The first parameter selects the line.

The second parameter is the station number.

The third parameter sets the size of the logos in pixels. If this parameter is omitted, the default pixel size is 30 pixels.

Please avoid adding these icons within the prose of articles: per Wikipedia's Manual of Style for icons, "Icons should not be used in the article body... This breaks up the continuity of the text, distracting the reader".

In addition, icons used in this way are primarily decorative, e.g. "aesthetics are in the eye of the beholder: one reader's harmless decoration may be another reader's distraction": While the icons provide visual cues in certain circumstances, writing in prose will usually suffice. Instead, provide a link to the services directly.

Line Abbreviation Code Example Color Note Hokus≈ç Line HS {{KSSN|HS|00}} HS00 #00BFFF Keisei Line KS {{KSSN|KS|00}} KS00 #005AAA includes Narita Sky Access Shibayama Railway SR {{KSSN|SR|00}} SR00 #008459 Shin-Keisei Line SL {{KSSN|SL|00}} SL00 #FF69B4

Code Result {{Keisei Station Numbering|name=KS|number=02|size=40}} KS02 {{KSSN|SR|01}} {{STN|Shibayama-Chiyoda}} SR01 Shibayama-Chiyoda [[Shibayama-Chiyoda Station|{{KSSN|HS|08|50}}]] HS08
